comment_0: First of all I just want to comment on how much I love Mariah and that I am proud to be the first to comment on this song. I also wanted to add that this song is at the top of my list on her best. The meaning is obvious...it is about a man who she is no longer with but misses dearly. It is about always reuniting with your true love and who u belong with!
comment_1: I Love this song, it really shows the real Mariah Carey from the old times is still around. Beautifully sung & written.

comment_5: WOW!  i love this song for so many reasons.  i knew it was a song that my baby liked and then we had some problems and every time i heard this song i just thought about them even more.  just everything about it reminds me of how i was feeling without this special person in my life.  i love my baby so much.  and this song is all that could keep me going through those rough times and now everything's all good and i'm so happy once again.  i love my baby so much and it's because of this song that i can be myself once again.  i love you sean!!!

comment_10: OK... I am a HUGE Mariah fan... and I LOVE this songs and so many other songs by Mariah BUT this is one of my ALL time favorite songs.  It is about true love... no matter where you go or who you go with... you will always think of your true love.  Unfortunately, real life doesn't play out like the video MUST of the time... so you just have to think of that person ALL the time!  It's a battle everyday... some days I keep it together, other days I fall apart!

comment_49:
This song, WOW, Mariah at her best!! 
Without a doubt this is the best song, she has ever released and the summer it came out, I played it so much, over and over again, and when it came on the radio me and my friends all sang along. Her live performance of this at BET and The Grammys 2006, where awesome!! Proving, with the right preparation, Mariah can still sing amazing!!
I dont know anyone that doesnt love this song, if you havent got it, download it! itunes does the CD single, with several tracks on, for ÃÂ£1.99!!
When I was single, for so long, if would give me hope that I would find someone, I love so much I can talk to on the phone till the sun comes up, someone I cant live without. This must be the most beautiful, brakeup song ever, specially if you lost someone you loved.
comment_50: I don't think that this song is about a love that Mariah let slip away and is now regretting it...I used to think that thought until I was listening to it the other night, and feeling down, but I realized that the song is the other way around.  Mariah didn't want to let the relationship go with the man, but pretended that she agreed (I didn't mean it when I said I didn't love you so...I should have held on tight).  I think that she misses this person and knows in her heart that they belong together and she is regretting allowing him to get away because she didn't fight hard enough for the love she knows they both felt...

comment_54: Personally I think that this Mariah Carey thing and also other pop music artists like Katy Perry, Jonas Brothers, Pussycat Dolls and other "talents" have a decent voice, marketable features, like decent sized boobs, and fairly quiet personalities, just crank out money for the corporations (major fucking record labels). and all these songs are shallow, yet somehow many people can somehow relate to them, and many people are unfortunately unable to see through the corporate greed behind these cookie-cutter artists. And I do not think that these songs are bad, or that these people have poor singing talent, but I absolutely hate, with every fiber of my being the greed and money there is to be made through these artists, and the shallow people who buy these records and cannot seem to understand anything aside from their own feelings and buying something that sounds good, but in essence, has no meaning.

comment_59: I get the feeling that this was written for Tommy. This song fits their life perfectly; even the video. Itâs obviously not about Nick because she was with him back then. Just listen.... She said that this was her favorite song on the album, and that it was written from a lot of memories. She even cries in the video. She also does live performances and really puts her feelings into the song. No other song I've seen her really get into it like this one. She looks like she is about to have a breakdown. There was a performance where she was ask about Tom, and immediately right after she performed this song. Not to mention that her wedding dress in the video looks a lot like the one she wore on her wedding day to Tommy. They said that they both were devastated when it ended. I feel she still loves him. I feel for her situation. Breaks my heart that she's trapped in this business, and can't be truly free. She clearly has a lot of pain. It's not all roses and sunshine.
comment_60: You know what? Honestly? I always thought it was kind of a message to the music industry. This was her comeback album, and she was still recovering from Glitter and her emotional breakdown. And I know Virgin paid her like 130million to leave because of how terrible Glitter was. Sebsequetly she had to sign to a slightly less powerful label and spent a few years resting. She made 'Charmbracelet' during this time, her lowest selling studio album at that point. And didn't she put on her old wedding dress for the video? Who the hell puts on their old (divorced) wedding dress? Sounds like someone misses someone alright. And wants to go back. Its like the song was a "take me back" message and the industry answered.
